intro: Dichaelia villosa, commonly known as the hairy dichaelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Dichaelia villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and woodland areas.
